125502.name: Hole-In-One Miniature Golf
125502.description:
User Summary

An overhead view miniature golf simulator. Game includes 5 complete 18-hole courses of different themes and difficulty. Play is controlled with only the mouse, using lines to represent direction and power of putts.

125503.name: Clubhouse Sports
125503.description:
User Summary

Clubhouse games offers six games including Foosball, skeeball, billiards, crazy pool, and shooting gallery. Each game can be played with one or two players.

125505.description:
The Red Skulls Faction is a free to print expansion for Frontiers. It was going to be released as official, boxed expansion but the publishers decided against it. It has been posted as free to print on the designers website.

This expansion adds a entirely new faction, the communistic pirates, the Red Skulls. There are brand new units, cards, and artifacts. The new units include, Turrets, Infiltrators, Pirates, Assault squads and more!
125505.name: Frontiers: Red Skulls Faction

125507.name: Freaks & Fairies
125507.description:
user summary

The core (and probably only) release for Freaks & Fairies. It consists of:


A tiny 46-page rulebook.



Thor's Hangnail, an equally tiny 10-page adventure.



A folded sheet (opening out to 8.5"x11") containing the various charts and tables for the game, plus a blank square grid.



A tiny 20-sided die (numbered as a d10).

125508.description:
The object of the game is to roll numbers 1-5 in sets of three to get right colored hen.

In his turn player rolls the 4 dice up to 3 times and may choose or reroll some of the dice. Player must collect three of a kind. The Hen shown on the dice count as a joker and can replace any number. If player succeed to roll f.e. 3 x three he gets a white hen.
Player who collet all 5 hens first is the winner.

There are some other game variant as well in this game to learn numbers and colors.
125508.name: 5, 2, 3: Gackerei

125509.name: Käpt'n Blaubär Raubmöwen-Zock
125509.description:
Children's card game that will help a little with their mental arithmetic.

Four cards are placed face up. Each player gets 6 cards. On their turn a player may play a card with the same value as one of the cards in the four face-up cards. He then takes both cards and starts a pile of won cards. Alternatively, he may play a card from his hand that is the total of two or more face-up cards:
Example. The four cards face up are 2, 3, 5, 7. The player uses an 8 card from his hand to take the 5 and the 3.

The face-up cards are replenished after every turn so that each player starts their turn with 4 cards in the middle.

If players run out of cards in their hand, they are dealt six more cards each and the game proceeds as before. When there are not enough cards to complete a later deal, the game ends and the one with the most won cards, wins.

125510.name: Falling Friends
125510.description:
User Summary

Captain Flyp's friends are just falling out of the sky and are in need of some assistance. Using Flyp's boat, help each friend land safely on the deck. Watch out as the pile gets bigger and bigger, one wrong move and someone will end up in the drink.

125511.name: Germz
125511.description:
Defend yourself against an onslaught of mischievous Germz! The only hope is to match the germs in order to keep your temperature down before they take over and infect you! Match similar germs to destroy them and reach your goals. A match of 4 or more releases powerful Antibodies capable of a powerblast that will destroy multiple rows of germs at once.

Source: The Developer Website.

125512.name: Above
125512.description:
The ultimate climbing experience for your iphone / ipod touch is here!

How high can you go? A pair of mysterious platforms aiming towards the sky have appeared! It’s your mission to see how far up you can explore without falling. Above is a new type of platform game that delivers simple, addictive and fun gameplay. It’s all about timing your jumps right, thinking fast and tackling different types of obstacles, and all you need is one finger to do it all!

Source: The Developer Website.

125513.name: Brutal Street
125513.description:
User Summary

Prove you have the might and the grit to gain supremacy over all the rival gangs. Form your own gang from a motley crew of characters and fight through over 40 locations. Each new face-off means more of the city to claim as your own.

125514.name: Air Vacation
125514.description:
Fly the friendly skies in this magnificent new game that defies traditional categorization. Build and design custom airships while traveling across the world, from Paris to New York, as you unlock new shops, restaurants, and more. Filled to the brim with meticulously detailed graphics and soothing tunes, this is a vacation that you’ll never forget.

Source: The Publisher Website.

125515.name: Kombi Lotto
125515.description:
Jigsaw puzzle with an educational value: 6 panels, each panel is shown in 6 designs, along with free fields for the matching image. On display is one place or activity - the train station, business, etc. - and the matching image must be placed.

The pictures on the blackboard and the pictures of this place are numbered alike.

Rules in the lid.

More detailed Information:
In this game it's important to observe. Each card show a person. This person can be a glazier, a gardener, a firefighter or another profession. These people find their place during the game on the white areas on the panels next to a representative exercise: the glazier replace broken glass, the gardener pour the flowers, the firefighter extinguish the burning house ...

In the first step a moderator is to be chosen. The moderator distribute the panels under the players and places the cards face down on a pile. Now he takes one card after another, shows the person and calls them by name. Each player looks now, whether the person fits to one of the pictures on his panel. If matching the player calls "for me", takes the card and places it in the appropriate space on the panel.

The first to complete all white boxes on his panel is the winner.

125516.name: Cut the Rope: Experiments
125516.description:
User Summary

Om Nom is back and this time, the little guy has been taken in by a scientist who decides to study him. Featuring over 150 levels and new ways to manipulate candy, do you have what it takes to complete the experiments?

125517.name: Super Lemonade Factory
125517.description:
Super Lemonade Factory is platformer with puzzle elements made for iOS.

The game features two playable characters called Andre and Liselot who are a married couple and own and operate a soft drink factory in the prosperous and tumultuous times of post-WWII.

Source: The Game Website.

125518.name: Publisher Portfolio: Adventure Planner
125518.description:
From publisher blurb:

Publisher Portfolio is online PDF resource series that RPG gaming companies can use in their product to help them “more complete”. The Publisher Portfolio series work with D20, OGL and 4th Edition product and publishers. Publisher Portfolio: Adventure Planner, provides RPG publishers with nearly 50 forms that can be used in their products including:

Campaign Overview: Including Published PDFs or Sourcebooks Used & Changes to published setting
Important Events in the Campaign History
Location in the Campaign
Character Race: Standard and Various others
Combat Round Check & Player Condition
Recent Campaign Events
Campaign Rogues Gallery & Supporting Cast List
Adventure Outline & Planned Scenes
Random Events & Custom Random Encounter Table
Plus over 40 other forms for D20, OGL and 4th Edition adventure and campaigns




All the forms listed in this resource can be used in any of their upcoming RPG ideas or projects. When a person acquires Publisher Portfolio, any of the forms in the PDF can be used in any of their own products as if they owned it them. This is due to the limited licensing agreement of Publisher Portfolio.

125519.name: Publisher Portfolio: Character Sheets
125519.description:
From publisher blurb:

Publisher Portfolio is online PDF resource series that RPG gaming companies can use in their product to help them “more complete”. The Publisher Portfolio series work with 4th Edition product and publishers. Publisher Portfolio: Character Sheets, provides RPG publishers with forms that can be used in their products including:

Character Sheet Character Sheets
Blank Power Cards (At-Will, Encounter and Daily)
Magical Item Cards
Initiative and Effects Tracker
History Sheet
Clan / Family Sheet




All the forms listed in this resource can be used in any of their upcoming RPG ideas or projects. When a person acquires Publisher Portfolio, any of the forms in the PDF can be used in any of their own products as if they owned it them. This is due to the limited licensing agreement of Publisher Portfolio.

125520.name: Fantasy Class Preview: The Martialist Heroic
125520.description:
From publisher blurb:

He is the inheritor of a martial tradition born in the depths of Horrdren's Claw. He fights with his hands and feet, his elbows and head. He carries no blade and wears only the lightest armor. He relies upon his agility and resolve to see him through. He is no monk. His abilities come not from a religion or the study of an ancient philosophy. Rather, his abilities come from the bone of his knuckle, the sinews of his arms, the knowledge of the measure of his own body. He is... the Martialist!

The Martialist--an unarmed combatant grappling or striking with his fist or foot--is unlike any current class for 4E D&D!

This FREE preview provides everything needed to play a new 4E character class up through the Heroic Tier, including over 45 new powers and ten new feats.

125521.name: Basic Maps
125521.description:
From publisher blurb:

Basic Maps is a compilation of three previous releases from The Fantasy Cartographic: Caverns, Tunnels and Caves: Battlemaps 1 and Caverns, Tunnels and Caves: Battlemaps 2, and Terrain Monkey's Hand Drawn Maps, Volume 1, which are no longer available separately.

From Caverns, Tunnels, and Caves: Located within these pages are 30 "old-school style" maps of the underground. Black and white, clean, and simple, these generic maps can be used by the imaginative DM (or GM) as the basis for heroic adventures in any realm!

From Terrain Monkey's Hand Drawn Maps: This presents the maps for five distinct fantasy locations for inclusion by a DM into his or her campaign world. It is for those DMs who take pleasure in using hand-drawn, quality maps when designing adventures. These maps are generic in that they can be used with any fantasy RPG.

Basic Maps brings you maps contained in those products "remastered" to appear more attractive and at a price lower than previously available.

125522.name: Caverns, Tunnels and Caves: Battlemaps 1
125522.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each of the locations presented here is described by three types of maps. The first, the Dungeon Master's Map, depicts the entire location on a single page. The second, the Battlemap Outline Map, shows the DM's Map divided into smaller maps, each numbered, that correspond to an equivalent battle map.

The battle maps themselves are the third type of map. These are to be printed out, taped together, and used as a playing surface by the DM and his player group.

Maps for five different subterranean locations.
109 pages of one-inch scaled battlemaps.
Black and white and easy on your printer!

125523.name: Soulbringer
125523.description:
From the box:

- Full motion-captured movements allow for stunning real-time attacks!

- Classic RPG Meets Epic 3D Adventure. You must succeed where the greatest of heroes have failed...

- One of the most involving and epic scenarios ever written for an RPG adventure.

- Over 60 spells to master based on the five elements: Water, Fire, Spirit, Air, Earth.

- A five-act plot transports you to a fully 3D world with over 1000 years of rich history.

- On your quest through the world of Rathenna, you will encounter over 60 speaking NPC's along with hundreds of others to meet and exciting locations to explore.

- Each weapon offers a unique set of attack options.

- A customizable and very realistic combat system that can be as simple or complex as you like.

125524.name: Hero Battle
125524.description:
Introduction
Hero Battle is a forum-based game of cutthroat strategy for eight or more players. The rules are deceptively simple—however game play is anything but.
Each player is assigned a Hero for the Battle, and as the game starts, all Heroes have an equal number of hit points (HP). Every turn, each player chooses two Heroes to hit and one Hero to heal. Any Hero reduced to zero is dead, and the last one left alive wins.
To complicate things further, Heroes can gain bonuses when their nemeses are killed or suffer penalties if their secret identity is revealed. Every Battle brings new twists and possibilities, from prison gangs to celebrity plastic surgery. So the players always have to remain on their toes.

125525.name: Nickropolis
125525.description:
Nickropolis is a grave robbing game, where you, as a thief, try to swipe as much loot from the necropolis as you can before you're sealed in forever. The hex card graveyard is laid out differently each game. Move from tomb to tomb, fighting the undead for their treasures, while avoiding traps and the other theives. One word of warning though. You'll want to race to get your goods to the surface. The necropolis locks itself down as you play, so you not only have to collect the loot, you must return to the center periodically and toss the loot up to score it. You can also pickpocket the other thieves if you don't want to fight the undead for it. Nickropolis is a quick, easy to learn, and rather brutal game. If you do join the undead in the tombs, you can still haunt the other thieves and win. Happy stealing!

The Story:

Your buddy Marley motions for you to join him at a dark table crammed in the corner of the bar. You and the other thieves go over and seat yourselves around him. He looks around nervously before he speaks.

"Got a job for you. You know they're planting Ol' Lady Elston tonight? Gonna do some spooky ceremony before they put her in that family necropolis. Listen up. Gatekeeper Willy is in charge of unlocking the mausoleum, and Willy likes his bottle. So I'm gonna make sure he has a nice full one tonight, because that's the kind of guy I am. Once he's hammered, you break in. Got a good map. I'll keep a lookout up top and sort out your loot. Just one thing, you got to be quick. That place has some kind of clockwork mechanism that will seal you down in there with all them dead Elston's, and you don't want that. They say some of them ain't quite as dead as they should be. Now whoever tosses up the most loot items will be known as the king of the thieves around here. You in?"

125526.name: Bumbler Bee-Luxe
125526.description:
Another busy day collecting pollen and making honey when--ATTACK! Marauding insects swarm into your hive, and it's up to you to defend it from crazed bees, hornets, spiders, armored beetles, and hoards of other crawling and flying invaders. The survival of the hive is in your hands!

Source: The Publisher Website.

125527.description:
This expansion will include quite a few additions to the game:

Dropped/Deployed Weapons. Sometimes there's no better way to get away than to put something in your opponent's path, like oil, smoke, caltrops, mines, cinder blocks ... you get the idea - this expansion includes passive and deployed weapons with expanded rules to incorporate them. But that's not all ...

Auxiliary Weapons. Sometimes there's no better way to finish off your enemy than with something explosive, like rockets - This expansion brings with it new goodies that can take the place of your secondary weapon slots. So say goodbye to Mr. peashooter and say hello to Mr. flamethrower.

Contact Weapons. Who said auto-combat wasn't up close and personal? For those who prefer ramming to shooting, this deck will include a wide range of options of Rams, blades, snares ... if it's vaguely pointy, it's in here
125527.name: Outrider: (Not So) Passive Agression

125528.name: Caverns, Tunnels and Caves: Battlemaps 2
125528.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each of the locations presented here is described by three types of maps. The first, the Dungeon Master's Map, depicts the entire location on a single page. The second, the Battlemap Outline Map, shows the DM's Map divided into smaller maps, each numbered, that correspond to an equivalent battle map.

The battle maps themselves are the third type of map. These are to be printed out, taped together, and used as a playing surface by the DM and his player group.

Maps for five different subterranean locations.
91 pages of one-inch scaled battlemaps.
Black and white and easy on your printer!

125529.name: Caverns, Tunnels and Caves: Battlemaps 3
125529.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each of the locations presented here is described by three types of maps. The first, the Dungeon Master's Map, depicts the entire location on a single page. The second, the Battlemap Outline Map, shows the DM's Map divided into smaller maps, each numbered, that correspond to an equivalent battle map.

The battle maps themselves are the third type of map. These are to be printed out, taped together, and used as a playing surface by the DM and his player group.

Maps for five different subterranean locations.
95 pages of one-inch scaled battlemaps.
Black and white and easy on your printer!

125530.name: Locales, Volume 1
125530.description:
From publisher blurb:

Locales, Volume 1 presents nine distinct and unique locations for inclusion by a DM into his or her campaign world. Each location is presented with one or more maps and accompanying text.

Locales, Volume 1 is not: A collection of fully-detailed and keyed gaming locations for plug-and-play use by a busy DM. Locales, Volume 1 is: An assortment of locations above and beyond the simple “keep”, “tavern” or “temple” that will add spice to any DM’s campaign. A resource for those DMs who don’t like to draw but still desire quality maps to aid in his or her storytelling. Nine locations. Thirty-five pages of maps and diagrams. Numerous plot ideas, adventure hooks, and story bits. Enough raw material to jump start the imagination of any DM!

A collection of 1”, miniature-scaled maps to be used as playing surfaces.
A collection of fully-detailed gaming locations.
A collection of poster quality, graphically-rich, ink-intensive maps in full color.
An collection of detailed maps depicting a wide range of exotic locations for use in fantasy settings.
A supplement for DMs who want to concentrate their efforts on writing exciting adventures instead of spending time drawing maps.




The Locales product line is designed specifically for that DM who needs only a map and an idea to create an exciting adventure for his or her playing group; Locales provides plenty of both!

125531.name: Find a Way, José!
125531.description:
"Find a Way, José! is a new and refreshing take on the Sliding-Block Puzzler genre for the iOS product family: iPhone, iPod Touch and iPad.
The game is quite simple:

Slide away irregularly shaped blocks in all-4 directions to pave the way for José to his long-lost Potion. Some obstacles are non-movable, and many levels have strange and surprising boundaries which make this game a unique and challenging experience. On his exciting journey, José will explore 6 exotic strange worlds and solve 70 mind-provoking riddles."

Source: The Developer Website.

125532.name: The Real Ghostbusters (GB)
125532.description:
The Real Ghostbusters, known in Europe as Garfield Labyrinth and in Japan as Mickey Mouse IV: Mahou no Labyrinth (ミッキーマウスIV 魔法のラビリンス?, "Mickey Mouse IV: The Magical Labyrinth") is a 1992/1993 action/puzzle video game developed and published by Kemco. The European version is based on Jim Davis's Garfield comic strips and the animated series Garfield and Friends, and the Japanese version is based on Walt Disney's Mickey Mouse, which is part of the Mickey Mouse side of Kemco's Crazy Castle series. The North American version is based on the animated series The Real Ghostbusters and contains ten more stages than the previous incarnations.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Real Ghostbusters (1993 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

125533.name: Orions: Legend of Wizards
125533.description:
This unique strategy game taking place in a world separated into many connected islands, called Orions. You must battle the Orion Lords defeating all that stand in your path in this world of Legendary Wizards.

You will fight using battle cards - monsters and spells, all unique not only by appearance, but also by their amazing abilities. Meet Liches and Demons, Efreets and Hydras, Elves and Priests, Magic Elementals and Unicorns in the final fight for the battle for Orions!

-Unique full-size strategy, never before on a Pocket PC scene: cards based fights, build orders, RPG elements, economics.
-Two game modes to play: Campaign and a Duel, where you can fight AI or a human opponent.
-TCP/IP based multiplayer, which means that you can play over Bluetooth, Wi-fi, or even Internet*.
-Six schools of magic, at least 12 unique cards in each.
-66 unique buildings to build.
-Powerful particle engine, animating every single card's ability or a spell.
-Everything to make the game complete: music and sound effects, comprehensive manual, interactive tutorial, epic story, and a great deal of one unique gameplay, never before on any PDA.

Source: The Developer Website.

125534.name: Skeleton Island
125534.description:
While taking a stroll on the beach of a skull-shaped island, you catch sight of a strange piece of paper sticking out the stand. Your curiosity leads you to dig in the sand with your hands, and you discover a golden coin and parts of a map that you piece together. What if the map leads to Captain Willain Kidd's fabulous treasure...

In Skeleton Island, players try to piece together treasure maps and find gold coins by digging in the "sand" – more specifically, by digging in the sand-decorated cards. To set up the game, someone takes the deck of 49 sand cards, splits them in half, turns one half face-down, shuffles the two halves together, then swishes the combined deck around on the table to make a pile of sand.

Each turn, a player takes either a standard turn or a piracy turn. In a standard turn, the player takes one "free" card – that is, a card not covered at all by any other card – and looks at it. The player can keep the card, or return it to the edge of the sand pile and draw a second card, which she must keep. (If only one or two cards are free, the player can close her eyes and blow on the pile to spread the sand.)

Players are searching for gold coins, which are valuable on their own, or halves and quarters of a treasure map. The first player to hand in a complete map of one of the five colors collects the island card of this color, which is worth five coins.

On a piracy turn, the player removes any three cards she's collected from the game, then either takes two consecutive standard turns or swipes any card from an opposing player.

When all the islands have been claimed or all the sand cards removed, the game ends and the player with the most coins wins.

rpg.25424: Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition, Playtest & Promotional Docs)

125535.name: Public Playtest Package (2012-05-24)
125535.description:
User summary:

The first playtest package released for D&D Next, aimed at testing the core mechanics of the game. This package included:


A letter from Mike Mearls (1 page)
A How To Play guide (31 pages)
A DM's Guidelines guide (9 pages)
A Bestiary (34 pages)
The Caves of Chaos adventure (an update of the classic Keep on the Borderlands, 29 pages)
Five pre-generated character sheets (9 pages)

125536.name: Trainz Simulator Mac
125536.description:
Trainz Simulator Mac includes everything you need to build and operate your own dream railroad. You can build a fun layout in minutes, faithfully recreate a steam railroad from days gone by or develop a fully fledged 100+ mile prototypical route; the choice is yours.

Drive... Steam, Diesel or Electric trains (and even trams, boats and cars)
Operate... a complete working rail line with interactive industries
Build... and customize your own living railroad
Share... your creations and your passion with other rail fans

Source: The Publisher Website.

125537.name: STD: The Game
125537.description:
The object is to "infect" as many players as you can using the cards in your hand and those available from a 5-card draw pool before the draw deck in gone. Each STD has a point value. At the end of the hand, the lowest score wins.

There are 3 ways to "infect" another player:

1- creating a 3 of a kind and passing it to a player
2- after each turn, give 1 of the STDs from your hand to the player on your right
3- using a special event card that allows you to give half of the STDs you've been "infected" with to another player.

Beware of the HIV card... if you end up with it at the end of the game your points double.

125539.name: Sandbox Hill
125539.description:
from the introduction

Sandbox Hill is a war-simulation game which uses army men as soldiers and die-cast metal cars as tanks. Want your soldier to shoot another soldier? Easy. Just shoot a rubber band at him from your soldier’s location, and if you hit, you inflict an injury. Sandbox Hill is fully adjustable for whatever size battle you desire. The important part is to make sure you have fun by mutilating army men and tanks. You couldn’t ask for more fun on a nice, sunny Saturday afternoon.

125541.name: 6 jours de Paris
125541.description:
Cycling through the Paris. Game is similar to Game of Goose.
Players roll the dice, advance their pawns and who finishes first is the winner.
Of course there are some special squares on the track.

125542.name: Artemis: Spaceship Bridge Simulator
125542.description:
Artemis is a multiplayer, multi-computer networked game for Windows computers.

Artemis simulates a spaceship bridge by networking several computers together. One computer runs the simulation and the "main screen", while the others serve as workstations for the normal jobs a bridge officer might do, like Helm, Communication, Engineering, and Weapon Control.

Artemis is a social game where several players are together in one room ("bridge") , and while they all work together, one player plays the Captain, a person who sits in the middle, doesn't have a workstation, and tells everyone what to do.

Source: The Developer Website.


User Summary

Artemis was created by Thom Robertson.

Note: Single player can take on all roles and switch between them via tabs. Supports play-by-internet, although it is recommended that players communicate via VOIP or telephone. Supports multiple independently staffed ships so maximum players per scenario may approach 18, possibly more. No official PvP support yet as of version 1.65.

125543.name: White Wolf Magazine (Issue 47 - Jul 1994)
125543.description:
Excerpt from the Table of Contents:
- Into the Midnight, Part 2 of an Adventure for Wraith: The Oblivion
- PeaceMaker: Gaming Fiction by Charles L. Grant
- Heckel & Kooch's Heroes Guild and Emporium: Officially sanctionaed article for Earthdawn
- Out of Character: Interview with Sam Lewis, President of FASA
- The Origin Awards: An Explanation by Mark Matthew-Simmons
- Powerful Characters and Their Families, or My Son the Adventurer: Article by Jonathan Tweet

125545.name: Sacred 3
125545.description:
Sacred 3 is a hack and slash brawler, part of the Sacred series, despite notable differences in both gameplay and design. Deep Silver, which acquired the license to Sacred 3 from former development studio Ascaron Entertainment, announced at Gamescom that the earliest it could publish the game would be in early 2012. The game was finally released on August 1, 2014. It was met with negative reception.

Another side-scrolling action brawler called Sacred Citadel acted as a prequel to the Sacred 3 story and released in 2013 to XBLA, PSN and Steam and developed by Southend Interactive.

Gameplay

There are a variety of classes to choose from but those from Sacred 2: Fallen Angel have not returned. They have been replaced by the Safiri Warrior and Ancarian Lancer. Some of the environments from the previous game made a return such as Castle Braverock.

Sacred 3 has four player co-op online and offline. Each ally has his or her own distinct set of active and passive skills. Everyone has a small number of abilities to equip at a time to keep the team from getting overpowered and may allow the combining of team powers to give the player additional ways to take down foes.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sacred 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

125546.name: Over the Top: The Dogs of War
125546.description:
A battle game of feints and bluffs where players vie for control of No Man's Land.

Game play is comprised of selecting from a limited pool of resources, and committing them to action. Players face off knowing only how much has been committed, but not what specifically is sitting before them. When the wave is revealed, they battle and ground is gained or lost.

Currently this game is in production and testing is available on Vassal

125547.description:
Grimoire Shuffle is a team vs. team labyrinth crawl that follows after the spirit of WizWar and Dungeon Twister. Players are apprentice librarians of the Imperial Magical Library, working to collect books from the various circulation desks of the library and return them to the archives. The first team who is able to relay all of its books to the end will be declared the winning team.

The library is constantly shifting, and as players reach the various circulation desks, they are able to acquire new books that grant them new spells. These spells are new ways to manipulate the library labyrinth as well as to interfere with foes. Players will have to watch out for their teammates as well as themselves, as everyone must complete their task in order to win.

boardgameversion.167414: English first edition (Level 99 Games Minigame Library)

125547.name: Grimoire Shuffle

boardgameintegration.214747: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Bass Orange Edition

125548.description:
Pixel Tactics is a head-to-head game of tactical combat for two players. Each player has an identical deck of 25 cards, from which they draft a leader. The leader's abilities alter vastly the strategy and playability of every other card in the deck, making the game playable in 25 different ways.

In the game, players take turns placing cards and attacking. Each card can activate in various ways, taking on offensive capabilities in the front rows of the unit, or support powers in the back rows. Cards can also be played as orders – powerful single-time effects that can turn the tide of battle.

Play continues until either player's leader is defeated. A typical game is best of three or five rounds.

Pixel Tactics takes place in the same world and uses many of the characters from Level 99 Games' BattleCON: War of Indines, but its game play is entirely unrelated.

boardgameversion.167415: English first edition (Level 99 Games Minigame Library)

125548.name: Pixel Tactics

125549.description:
Infinity Dungeon is a storytelling party game for four or more players. Players take on the roles of outlandish characters like the Postman, Rock Star, Evil Overlord, and Archaeologist and must attempt to escape from Infinity Dungeon.

Each turn of play, a room will be revealed from the room deck and read aloud. Each room contains a puzzle, trap, or monster to overcome. At this point, the party leader must describe how he will utilize his own character's powers, plus the powers of his willing allies, in order to get his team safely from this room and into the next.

Each player votes on whether they believe the plan is likely to succeed. After this point, a card is drawn and a random number printed on it is compared to the number of confidence votes the player received. If he meets this number or exceeds it, the GM must narrate how his plan succeeds. If he does not, the GM must narrate how the plan fails and results in his grisly death.

Players who die receive a new character class and get immediately back into the action. When the team completes a pre-determined number of rooms, they win!

boardgameversion.167416: English first edition (Level 99 Games Minigame Library)

125549.name: Infinity Dungeon: Peril without End

125553.name: Taramythica Shard Expansion
125553.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




designer summary

This is the first Shard (world setting) expansion for the Shards of the Shattered Universe Role Playing Game.

Taramythica is a wild and largely untamed world not unlike earth during the dark and middle ages. However, the world in this shard is a distorted reflection of earth, where evolution and cultural development took many twists and turns, vastly different from the original. Numerous intelligent races and creatures, both frightening and wondrous, evolved alongside several subspecies of humans.

In this world, technology and civilization did not develop far beyond the iron age. Due to the primeval nature of this world, and the absence of advanced technologies, its inhabitants have learned to harness the extraordinary powers Mythos and Spirit. These forces are particularly pure and strong in Taramythica.

The Taramythica Shard expansion supplements the Core Rules, and will provide players of the Shards of the Shattered Universe Role Playing Game a completely developed, unique and original fantasy setting. The expansion includes new options for character creation, including six human subspecies and six non-human species, each with their own culture. In addition, the set will include an expanded bestiary, new weapons, armor, and equipment, including extraordinary (mythical and spiritual) items ranging from common to legendary power and rarity. Furthermore, the expansion will provide detailed crafting, mythical enchanting, and spiritual empowering rules. Finally, to help get players started in their campaigns and adventures, we have included a large variety of story hooks, unique to each region of Taramythica.

The expansion will be available in softcover and PDF format, concurrently with the release of the Shards of the Shattered Universe Core Rules and Combat Card Sets.

125554.name: Timeline
125554.description:
Timeline is a trivia board game about an exciting journey through Switzerland.
Players answer the questions and if these are correct place that card in front of their teammates with a series of eight cards. The cards must be arranged so that the numbers increase from left to right annually.
The game consists of important events in Swiss history, politics, entertainment, business, traffic, sports, personalities, and inventions.

125557.name: Dr. Playwell's Controlling Your Anger Card Game
125557.description:
From the publisher's website:
Help kids take control of their anger before it takes control of them. This game teaches children how to recognize and change the things that make them angry, how to compromise in situations where there is a conflict, how to talk about their feelings rather than act on them, and how to self-monitor their emotions. The bonus activities in this game help children learn positive ways to handle frustration in their day-to-day lives.

Appropriate responses to the question or activity on the back of the card allow the player to collect cards, and the first player to collect two from each "suit" wins.

This card game is also part of the Dr. Playwell's Amazing Card Games Collection.

125558.name: Jeu du Robert
125558.description:
Word game in grid as Scrabble and other similar games.
In his turn player roll the dice and advance his pawn around the board and places the letters to same row or column he stand and scoring points by forming words.

Player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

125560.name: Kangaroos & Koalas: The Aussie game of ups and downs
125560.description:
There are 4 games and a double-sided playing board. The main game, Kangaroos and Koalas, is a Snakes and Ladders type of roll and move game, where the aim of the game is to reward positive character traits displayed by the kangaroos and to penalise negative character traits displayed by the koalas by moving playing pieces to higher or lower squares. For example, landing on 'Caution' moves a player up to Safety' and landing on 'Selfish' moves a player back to 'Lonely'.

The second game, 'Where's Kolo?' is a search and find game, involving luck as well as colour, number and picture recognition. Players race around the board, trying to find Kolo Koala underneath special gumnut tokens. Finding a "Here's Kolo" token allows a player to collect a piece of a jigsaw puzzle. The first to complete their puzzle is the winner.

Rules for two other games, using the same components, are included in the box.

Components: 1 double-sided game board, 1 die, 6 playing pieces, tokens, 4 jigsaws

125561.description:
This game brings the set, Incredible Courage at Austerlitz, to its completion. This third game contains the French and Coalition forces that fought in the northern part of the battlefield. General Bagration, given orders to move toward Brunn to the west, dutifully moves out around 10am and is given a nasty surprise. While his forces, and the forces of Prince Lichtenstein (5,000+ cavalry!), are well equipped, they are outnumbered by the French Vth Corps under Marshall Lannes and the Cavalry Reserve under the trusted leadership of Marshall Murat. Murat's forces contain a mix of heavy and light cavalry to the total of around 7,000.
Needless to say the action is hot and intense.

This game is an expansion and requires Telnitz to be played. It contains a great added value feature not originally planned, but included at the same proposed release price, of a counter sheet with battalion counters. These battalion counters can be used in lieu of the company counters and will speed up game play. Rules for using them are fairly simple and short, allowing for fighting the battle, not the rules.
125561.name: Incredible Courage at Austerlitz: Santon

125562.description:
Operation Crusader builds on the award winning Armored Knights - Operation Gazelle game system. With variable strenghts and die roll modifiers the players never know exactly how well their troops will fight. This aspect of the game system makes for a really interesting battle. You as the commander must try to put the best elements together and give your force the best chance for success. But the troops sometimes don't follow the plan or fight as well as you want. This variability in performance is what makes the game so intense. Infantry, Artillery, and Armor units are modeled at Battalion level and supporting arms are modeled at company level. The Commonwealth forces must releive Tobruk and the Axis must take Tobruk. These battles on the Egyptian frontier were fluid and chaotic, but also fierce and unrelenting. Air support plays a prominent role as does leadership.

The rules are structured along the 7 Battlefield Operating Systems, Command and Control, Maneuver, Fire Support, Air Defense, Intelligence, Combat Service Support, and Mobility and Survivability. This structure allows for simulating the effects of Military Intelligence (radio intercepts) on the battle, as well as obstacles and fortifications.

Included will be scenarios that cover the Battle for Sidi Rezegh and the Dash to the Wire. They will only require (1) 22x34 map equivalent and a smaller part of the counter order of battle.
125562.name: Armored Knights North Africa: Operation Crusader

131681.name: Armored Knights North Africa: Operation Venezia

125570.name: Steel Reign
125570.description:
From Back of Case

Tank warfare in unparalleled realism

Command fully-armed, top secret military tank prototypes in a hard core 3D duel to the death.
- Deploy 12 high-tech armored vehicles
- Wage war on 10 huge battlefields
- Lay waste to interactive environments
- Wield advanced weaponry
- Experience real terrain technology
- Crush your adversary in 2-player combat.

125571.name: Fuel: Fast Action Dice
125571.description:
Players identified by a color, place two marker chips on the board. Similar to Craps, there are several types of options with various odds. In addition to single roll options, one section has two levels. Upon successfully winning Level 1, Level 2 (the second marker chip, if placed in Level 2) is activated and increases the potential for an exponentially high payoff on the next dice roll.

Although calibrated for casino-style wagering, the premiere edition is configured for the accumulation of points. All options on the board state the point values. Everyone plays concurrently and independently, utilizing the same dice rolls. Each player lists the points acquired and after (30) minutes of play, the scores are totaled. The player with the highest score wins the game. In the event of a tie, play continues one dice roll at a time until the tie is broken.

Level 1 is the spark that can ignite Level 2 to Fuel an exponential payoff.

125572.name: Alien Resurrection
125572.description:
Back of cover

Get ready to meet the mother of all aliens.

Ellen Ripley died trying to wipe out the Aliens. Now, 200 years later, scientists have resurrected Ripley- along with the Alien Queen- hoping to create the ultimate weapon. Teamed with a crew of renegade space pirates on a research vessel headed for Earth, they must fight for survival and destroy the Aliens once and for all.

- Try to outwit the Alien intelligence as they communicate with each other; react to sound and player tactics; and hunt alone and in packs.

- Stay alert. Watch your back. Aliens can run along walls and ceilings.

- Ambient sound and game sound effects straight from the Alien Resurrection movie.

125573.name: Star Wars The Clone Wars AAT Attack
125573.description:
Your mission is to seek out and destroy a Separatist Armored Assault Tank (AAT). You will need to get into close quarters with the tank and blow it up with a blast from your Thermal Detonator. Use the debris scattered around the battlefield for cover and look to the Jedi Anakin's Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi for aid. But beware, the evil and powerful Asajj Ventress also lurks about the battlefield.

On a 3D hex filled board, using roll and move mechanics, maneuver your plastic pre-painted Clone trooper miniature around the board trying to stay out of the firing direction of the large plastic AAT. Either through the use of cards or die rolls, your turn may also consist of firing red plastic discs with the AAT at the other plyers' Clone Troopers.

The game comes with a "basic" version of play using only a single 12 sided die as well as an "advanced" version using a 6 sided die and cards.

125575.name: Lotto spielen mit dem kleinen Bär
125575.description:
The Lotto game has four busy picture boards and the object is for each player to be the first to collect all six picture cards that correspond to his picture board.

To play:
1. Each player takes one of the four picture boards. The 24 cards are shuffled and placed on the table face-down.
2. The first player takes one of the cards, flip it and tries to find the same picture on his board. If he has found the picture, he place the card on one of the six squares around his picture board.
3. If the player don´t find the same picture on his Board, he place the card face-down again.
4. The game continues until one player has filled all six squares on his picture board.

ARTÍCULOS:
