Play against a friends by yourself or like a team.

As a player you can play action cards to make action:
Throw Shooting, Rebounding, Fouls, Foul Drawing, Blocking Shots, Stealing the Ball, Assists, Defense and others.

ACTION CARDS that keep the game moving fast while at the same time allowing everything that takes place in a real game to occur.
Try the game and claim some fame.

Basketball Team Card Game... are you man or are you meat?

Each game begins with draft and then the season begins.
Each game turn represents individual player attack.
Players play actions cards and earn victory points based on their actions and teams' actions.

The point of the game is to get the most victory points.

The Game of Professional Basketball.
125788.name: Basketball Team card game

125789.description: The Great Houses each take long gambles in A Roll of the Dice, with all of the Seven Kingdoms at stake. As they double down on the strategies they hope will win them the Iron Throne, the Great Houses introduce new players to the game of thrones and explore new locations. They reinforce their positions by recruiting Armies, hiring Mercenaries, and treating with their Allies. Nonetheless, at the heart of every gamble is an element of chance, and fate plays a large role in this climactic conclusion to the intrigues and struggles Beyond the Narrow Sea. The Chapter Pack introduces eight new events that can drive thrilling plot twists into your games.
125789.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Roll of the Dice

39953.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game

125790.name: Excaliba
125790.description:
From Box:

Rescue the princess from the evil wizards and his demons. To do so, you must collect pieces of the exit door in a each room of the castle.

125791.name: Journey from Darkness: Strider Returns
125791.description:
"Strider II (released in North America under the title of Journey from Darkness: Strider Returns), is a side-scrolling platform game published by U.S. Gold (under license from Capcom USA) and originally released for various computer platforms in 1990. It is a European-developed sequel to Capcom's arcade game Strider, which U.S. Gold previously ported to home computers in Europe."

Source: Wikipedia, "Strider II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

From the back of the European edition box

"The warrior returns with a vengeance in his ultimate fight for freedom! A flash of steel, a blast from his devastating Gyro laser gun - Strider's back in action, pulverizing the enemy and striving for justice. This time, there will be no limits... no mercy... no surrender!"

125792.name: El Viento
125792.description:
"El Viento (エル・ヴィエント Eru Viento, derived from Spanish meaning 'The Wind') is a 2D platform video game released by Wolf Team and published by Renovation Products for the Sega Mega Drive/Sega Genesis game console in 1991. It is the second in a trilogy of games, which include Earnest Evans and Anetto Futatabi.

The game possesses many references to H. P. Lovecraft's esteemed Cthulhu Mythos. As with many Wolf Team games, the music was composed by Motoi Sakuraba."

"The game shares the same fictional universe with Earnest Evans, and happens several years later.

New York City, 1928. A mad religious leader known as Henry seeks to awaken the ancient and malevolent god Hastur. A sorceress named Restiana offers herself to Henry as a sacrifice for a cause which will bring the inevitable down fall of mankind.

There are some people that have descended from Hastur's ancient bloodline, one of which is the young Peruvian sorceress, Annet Myer. With some assistance from Earnest Evans, Annet attempts to stop the cult from resurrecting Hastur using the very spells of this bloodline."

"El Viento is a platformer. The player has access to an endless supply of boomerangs and eventually up to five spells: fireballs, water currents, explosions, arrows, and the wind cutter."

Source: Wikipedia, "El Viento", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

125793.name: perChance (Issue 6 - Sep 1991)
125793.description:
Contents

•Editorial - by Darren Graham
•The Strange Case of the Rusty Corpse - Cthulhu by Gaslight Scenario by Jim Johnston & Colin Thompson
•Neighbours II - Death comes to Ramsey Street - Generic Scenario by Jonathan Turner
•The Game with No Name - Western Style BRP roleplaying by Darren Graham

125794.name: Anetto Futatabi
125794.description:
"Annet Futatabi (アネット・再び), is a 1993 side scrolling, beat-em-up video game released by Wolf Team, only in Japan for the Sega Mega-CD game console. It is the final in a trilogy of games, which include Earnest Evans, and El Viento. The menus and game screens are all in English, while the dialogue and ending credits are in Japanese."

"Set in the same fictional universe as Earnest Evans and El Viento, the story takes place two years after El Viento, and concludes the story of Annet and Earnest. Zigfried's true motives are finally revealed as well. Being rescued from certain sacrifice by father figure Ernest Evans, Annet travels across Europe and encounters a local sect that wants her special pendant. After an attempted ambush in the sect's castle, she barely escapes, and begins another quest to protect the world from destruction."

"Unlike the first and second entries, which are 2D platform video games, Annet Futatabi is a side scrolling beat-em-up that deeply resembles Sega's Golden Axe and Bare Knuckle franchises. However, like the previous installments, the story is told through cutscenes between each brief multi-scrolling level, which includes a boss character, who appears out of thin air, usually wielding a weapon.

Annet's magic has 5 levels and is regulated by a power meter, and regenerates automatically. As her power meter increases, the higher her magical attacks become. The levels range from wind, earth, water, fire, and death. Wind is the lower level, while death is the highest level. However, magic cannot be used against the bosses. In addition to magic, Annet wields a sword, rather than bladed boomerangs. There are not any other weapons or power-ups included in the game, other than health restoration items.

Annet's journey ranges from escaping an enemy castle, being captured and forced to fight in a colosseum, spelunking in a tomb,"

Source: Wikipedia, "Anetto Futatabi", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

125795.name: Game Geek (Issue 30 - Jun 2012)
125795.description:
From the table of contents


Musing of the Avalon Stogie
Behind the Game, Heroes Wear Masks
Coral Throne Chapter 20
GROMM
Avalon Pathfinder
Excerpt from Today's Promise
Wired Issue #3
Multi-Verse
Heroes Wear Masks Adventure
Nova Blast
Avalon Models
Arcana
Reviews
What's New
Free Stuff

125796.description:
The ground-breaking GENESIS '48 module sold out a decade ago, and has been awaiting a new edition for years. Additionally, the follow-on game, bringing in 1967 and 1973 actions has been waiting patiently for delivery to your gaming tables. Bringing together these two elements has resulted in an all new GENESIS '48 2nd Edition complete with counters and scenarios for 1948 and 1956, with the first taste of 1967 and 1973 actions. The Israelis get a new nationality color and a plethora of new counters are provided for Arab and Israeli armies. What's more, the soldier art is also new, none of that which was used in the first edition is carried over.

Contents: 22 scenarios, 8" x 22" geomorphic map (KB1), 28-page rulebook, 1 page charts, 2 duplicate sets of 4 die-cut countersheets (for a total of 1,616 counters).

Genesis II #01 Sons of Galilee Syrian Israeli 1948-05-20
Genesis II #02 Locust Swarm Egyptian Israeli 1948-12-07
Genesis II #03 Etziongrad Arab Israeli 1948-05-13
Genesis II #04 Buying Time Egyptian Israeli 1948-05-23
Genesis II #05 Triple Play Arab Israeli 1948-06-06
Genesis II #06 Trapping Nasser Israeli Arab 1948-10-19
Genesis II #07 Fatih-Allah Syrian Israeli 1948-06-10
Genesis II #08 I Dream of Jenin Israeli Iraqi 1948-06-03
Genesis II #09 Palestinian Prokhorovka 5.00 Israeli Arab 1948-07-16
Genesis II #10 Edge of the Sword Arab Israeli 1948-01-14
Genesis II #11 Ben-Jabo! Israeli Egyptian 1948-05-29
Genesis II #12 The Whiskey Wager Israeli Arab 1948-04-21
Genesis II #13 Into the Arava Israeli Arab 1950-11-30
Genesis II #14 No Time to be Thamed Israeli Egyptian 1956-10-30
Genesis II #15 The Archers of Um Sheham Israeli Egyptian 1956-10-31
Genesis II #16 Ambush at Mitla Israeli Egyptian 1956-10-31
Genesis II #17 Final Act Israeli Egyptian 1956-11-02
Genesis II #18 Push to Um-Katef Israeli Egyptian 1967-06-06
Genesis II #19 Bloody French Hill Jordanian Israeli 1967-06-06
Genesis II #20 Molotov Inferno Israeli Syrian 1948-05-20
Genesis II #21 Syrian Spirit Israeli Syrian 1967-06-09
Genesis II #22 Isolation Strategy Israeli Egyptian 1973-10-08
125796.name: Genesis II

125797.name: Mech Hangar
125797.description:
From the Introduction:

Constructed from steel and concrete this hidden underground structure is the base of operations for two gigantic war machines. Currently these two three story high steel giants are powered down and stand inert in their respective positions for maintenance and resupply. Two steel grid walkways supported by massive steel beams surround the room and allow easy access to the machines above ground level. While one giant gateway leads out of the hangar towards the surface only two comparatively small blast doors allow access deeper into this underground structure. Behind the two mechs a small number of metal crates rest on the ground. The warning signs covering them suggesting that their content is highly volatile.

125798.name: KOR
125798.description:
Roll the Haul before you Lose it All!!!

Buckle up. Keep On Rolling (KOR) is the bold press your luck dice game geared to get your wheels spinning AND have you screaming for the air brakes at the same time! Every player is in the drivers seat on their turn and rolls the jumbo dice to log 25, 50 or 100 miles at a time. Each roll (haul) must obey the rules of the open road. How many times does a player roll the dice on their turn? As many times as possible and they Keep On Rolling until no miles have been rolled or they run into a dead end, Players can roll their turn to a slow and steady STOP or lose everything they have rolled by hitting a DEAD END! Roll a U-TURN and you pass the dice to any player, who then is U-TURNED and rolling against their score! The first player to log 6,000 miles wins!

125799.name: Cha-Ching
125799.description:
8 Card Rummy with Dice & Money!

Cha-Ching gives you the rush of rummy with a blend of dice for added SPICE! Players attempt to build an eight card hand to equal the sum of the house number rolled each round from various cards values. But players can cha-change things up mid play with CHACHING! Cards that allow you to re-roll the dice or trade hands with another player but don’t get caught trying to change things up before someone goes out each round.

125800.name: 5th Gear
125800.description:
Roll your dice and Place your Gears!

The rules are simple: interlock five of your color gears with the white gear and keep others from doing the same. Players roll 2 twelve-sided dice on their turn to determine their gear placement and get the option to: place 2 gears, one on each number rolled OR place 1 gear on the sum of the roll? But here comes the monkey wrench, players can bump opponents off peg(s) that match their roll and replace it with their own. The family fun factor: No two games are ever the same! The unique game board allows players to randomly place number tokens at the start of each game which results in fun new challenges and endless playability.

Family game night will never get old!

125801.name: Klexx Party Junior
125801.description:
Who wants a birthday party of Klexx the dog needs luck and tactical skills.

Players roll the dice and move on the inner round with many obstacles to grab the four different pieces of his color. Player may use his magic bone to get in right square faster.

Player who gets his 4 puzzle pieces first is the winner.

125804.name: Forsooth!
125804.description:
publisher Blurb

A greatly expanded update of the Game Chef 2011-winning game of the same name, Forsooth! challenges players to improvise one of the bard’s greatest lost work for the amusement of their friends. It will be available in paperback, pdf, and ebook on June 22.

In Forsooth! players must use their wits, their hammiest acting, and some tactically deployed asides and soliloquies to win applause from their friends. They will swear solemn vows, and be challenged to either stick with them, or tear them asunder in dramatic fashion. And they’ll control multiple characters, making the game a true smorgasbord for roleplaying aficionados. The game plays in a single session, with no game master and no need for advance preparations.

-Spoiled Flush Games

125805.name: Le Nain Ivre
125805.description:
user summary

GM adventure specially designed for beginners, it's the French version of A Riverboat Adventure.

125806.name: À la poursuite du serpent d'argent
125806.description:
user summary

A GM adventure for characters between level 1 and 3, it is the translation of Trollstone Caverns: Lair of the Silver Serpent Redux. Includes maps and tables.

125807.name: The Slumbering Tsar Saga (Pathfinder Version)
125807.description:
From the back cover:

The Wait is Over
After eight years in development Frog God Games finally brings The Slumbering Tsar Saga in its entirety: three books, 14 full adventure modules, more than 80 maps, and hundreds of encounters all compiled into one epic volume.

Travel from the dusty frontier streets of The Camp to the innermost workings of a demonic plot 10,000 years in the making. Witness the bleak expanse of the Desolation, roam the ruined streets and bastions of the Temple-City of Tsar, and plumb the depths of the vast Citadel of Orcus, lost from the knowledge of mankind for hundreds of years. Do the heroes of today dare tread where legends of the past failed?

The Truth Lies Within
The Slumbering Tsar Saga includes the three mega-adventure books: The Desolation, Temple-City of Orcus, and The Hidden Citadel combined into one continuous adventure path taking characters from 7th level all the way to 20th level and above. Each book includes hundreds of different encounters for thousands of hours of play as well as new magic items, monsters, and player handouts. Challenge your players with this adventure of epic proportions, but warn them to bring extra character sheets.

Only true heroes of legend will emerge victorious. Orcus takes the rest.

125809.name: Mega Run: Redford's Adventure
125809.description:
Redford’s brother and sister have been kidnapped by a mysterious monster and taken far away! Take off on an amazing adventure across multiple worlds and dozens of challenging stages. Find Redford’s lost family and discover new worlds to explore by following the trail of stolen coins and Forest Gems!

Mega Run – Redford’s Adventure is the long-awaited followup to Mega Jump, which has been downloaded by over 24 million people around the world!

In Mega Run, you’ll once again take on the role of Redford the adorable woodland-dwelling monster, as he dashes across beautifully rendered worlds to rescue his lost friends and recover the stolen Forest Gems.

A Brand New Adventure

Journey across astonishing and beautiful Worlds, each divided into 16 fast-paced Stages filled with multiple randomized routes, incredible powerups, and all kinds of hidden secrets to discover!

Mega Run is aiming to be a genre-defining game, bringing true platform gaming to touch devices, with intuitive controls and gorgeous visuals.

Ridiculous Non-Stop Fun


One-touch gameplay – jump, float, boost and fly with just one control!
Randomized stages make the game unique every time you play!
Turn enemies into ice blocks with Freezo!
Jet over platforms and enemies with GravBoots!
Unleash your inner monster with the terrifying Embiggenator!
Become a blazing comet with the ridiculously powerful Fireball!
Take on weird and wiley enemies trying to stop you in your tracks!
Blast through destructible blocks to collect gems and coins!
Launch into the air with powerful cannons!
Beautiful retina graphics!
Hilarious sound effects!
Challenges and special achievements make every stage replayable!


Source: The Game Website.

125810.name: The Program
125810.description:
From publisher's site:
"The Program is an introductory adventure for the survival horror role-playing game, Abandon All Hope. Unlike previous adventures for Abandon All Hope, The Program takes a new approach to building atmosphere and dread by focusing on one player at a time. The Program is, in essence, a solo adventure written in the style of “choose your own adventure” novels, with the intent of providing each new player with a unique introduction to the setting."

125811.name: Kapow!: The Super RPG Version 1.1
125811.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sky's the Limit!

Unlock the power of your imagination! Any kind of superhero, any powers, any scope... One Simple, Fast, Exciting system!
Kapow! gives you everything you need to play the superhero RPG of your dreams: Powers, vehicles, sidekicks, bases...it's all there, and You don't need a degree in accounting to create the hero you've always wanted to play!

Does your superhero game sound like a comic book? If you use Kapow! it will. Kapow! uses the SFX! System, which blends free-form play, with players deciding whether their actions are plausible within the superhero genre, and dice-driven mechanics where the degree of success--or failure--can come as a surprise to all, and the Tension is real.

125812.name: Zounds!: The Fantasy RPG

rpghonor.23185: 2012 Indie RPG Award - Best Free Game - Runner-Up

125812.description:
From publisher blurb:

Journey into the Fantastic

Unlock the power of your imagination!
Any kind of fantasy adventure, any powers, any scope...
one Simple, Fast, Exciting system!

Zounds! gives you everything you need to play the Fantasy RPG of your dreams: Powers, mounts, equipment, non-human races, factions, ruling kingdoms, war, questing...it's all there, and you don't need a degree in accounting to create the hero you've always wanted to play!

Does your game sound like a Fantasy Story? If you use Zounds! it will. Zounds! uses the SFX! System, which blends free-form play, with players deciding whether their actions are plausible within the fantasy genre, and dice-driven mechanics where the degree of success--or failure--can come as a surprise to all, and the Tension is real.

Play Zounds! And begin your Adventures today!

125813.name: Sins of the Past
125813.description:
From publisher's site:

"Sins of the Past is an adventure for the sci-fi horror role-playing game, Abandon All Hope

Having survived Perdition and managing to keep themselves alive since, the player characters find that there’s more at stake than just survival. Various forces are moving towards an enigmatic goal, one which seems threatening at best, apocalyptic at worst. With the help of old allies the characters begin to set in motion a plan to build strength, so that when the enemy’s schemes come to fruition there will be at least some show of resistance against the powers of the Nether.

In Sins of the Past the characters will face new and difficult challenges; their ability to problem solve will be tested in their dealings with former friends, their level-headedness will be vital to preventing unnecessary bloodshed, and their ability to survive in the wreckage of a ship that is slowly turning into an alien landscape both cold and dark will pit them against foes both alien... and hauntingly familiar."

125814.name: Oblivion
125814.description:
From publisher's site:

"Oblivion is an adventure for the sci-fi horror role-playing game, Abandon All Hope

The action of Oblivion revolves around a harrowing attempt by the player characters to prepare the survivors of Perdition for the coming onslaught of the Nether‘s native creatures. In the process they will struggle to thwart their own human enemies, meet new and powerful forces, and perform a daring raid on the lair of the dark alliance of the UltraMax Psychos and Embracers, culminating in the rescue of the one man who can give hope to stop the tide of evil.

Oblivion marks the final installment of the first campaign for Abandon All Hope, the “Incursion”."

125815.name: Zap!: The Science Fiction RPG
125815.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore Strange New Worlds!

Unlock the power of your imagination! Any kind of Science Fiction Hero, any powers, any scope...
one simple, Fast, Exciting system!

Zap! gives you everything you need to play the Science Fiction RPG of your dreams: Powers, vehicles, equipment, aliens, bases, interstellar travel, trade...it's all there, and you don't need a degree in accounting to create the hero always you've always wanted to play!

Does your game sound like a Science fiction Story? If you use Zap! it will. Zap! uses the SFX! System, which blends free-form play, with players deciding whether their actions are plausible within the superhero genre, and dice-driven mechanics where the degree of success--or failure--can come as a surprise to all, and the Tension is real.

Play Zap! And explore the COSMOS today!

125816.name: Zoolandia
125816.description:
Players take turns rolling the special die to move their pawns around the board and home to their zoo hut.

The die has images of the different animals and a hut.

125817.name: Blue Jays Suck-Ball
125817.description:
Two players go head-to-head in the World Series of Baseball!

Using a standard deck of playing cards divided into reds and blacks, each player takes control of a team and attempts to out-pitch and out-score the other player by turning over cards representing their Defense or Offense. In what plays a little like War (injected with hardcore baseball strategy), highest card wins and determines whether the batter gets a hit or is out. Complete with rules for bunting, sac flys, stealing and more, you'll be a Major League coach in no time!

Meticulously crafted by a baseball fanatic and his brother while watching their Major League home team lose miserably, this game will leave you cheering, yelling, and having a Grand Slam of a time. You'll never have to make it out to the ballgame again!

Check out the Files section for the full rules.

125818.name: Waveform
125818.description:
User Summary

Waveform is a puzzle game where you control the wave path of a particle. By changing the amplitude and frequency of the wave the particle is traveling you pick up powerups and avoid obstacles.

This is a game with some extremely unique gameplay.

125819.name: Espírito do Século
125819.description:
user summary

Espírito do Século is the Brazilian Portuguese edition of the Spirit of the Century pulp rpg, in an all new and exclusive layout for the Brazilian market and featuring the art from Germana Viana and translation from Fabio Emílio Costa and Thiago Fernandes Pereira.

From the back cover (in Portuguese):

"PREPARE-SE PARA A LUTA DO SÉCULO!

Através das eras, os Centuriões do Clube do Século lutaram para moldar a história para o aperfeiçoamento do homem.

MAS ELES NÃO ESTÃO SOZINHOS!

Forças sombrias estão agindo. Sombras, invocadas pela morte do passado, assombram os Centuriões a cada turno. Antigos Milenares dobram nações inteiras à suas vontades, cumprindo ordens ocultas... e arcanas.

O TEMPO DE AGIR E AGORA!

O mortal Doutor Matusalém busca desemaranhar o próprio tempo com sua solução para a Equação da Eternidade.

Gorila Khan espeita a África da conquistada Atlântida.

Cientistas loucos, conjuradores estranhos e ditadores famintos por poder procuram acabar com o destino da humanidade.

É o século final do segundo milênio e você a última esperança da humanidade!

TORNE-SE UM CENTURIÃO!

Espírito do Século é um jogo pulp único e completo, baseado no premiado sistema FATE. Tudo o que vocês precisa para jogar são alguns amigos, alguns dados e esse livro."

125820.name: Sequester
125820.description:
User Summary

A little boy is visited in his dream by his dead sister. Follow her voice and try to solve 3D puzzles while learning more about her life and death. The tone of the game is dark and ominous.

125821.name: Pathways (Issue 16 - Jun 2012)
125821.description:
From the publisher's website

You'll find articles by Will Mcardell (The Secrets of Tactical Archetypes I & II), Crieighton Broadhurst (Raging Swan Press), Ron Lundeen (Ron Amok Games), Nathan Land, (AdventureaWeek) David Paul (Pathways Editor-in-Chief). Including Cartography by Todd Gamble and Eric Blische. Also you will find the top products with reviews by Endzeitgeist and KTFish7, and an interview with Mark Gedak of Purple Duck Games.

125824.name: Invasive Species
125824.description:
You and your fellow scientists have been sent to Earth.
Your mission: Conquest
Your weapon: An organism Earthlings call a "plant". Your "plant" has been created to combine with other plant species on Earth and spread across the planet, changing the biosphere to support your own race.

Each player builds a nursery of 15 cards and, starting with the Alien Seedling - Code Name: Noraby, match numbered points along the sides and corners of the cards. However, each plant the seedling takes over may radically change the game.

And there are other things in the garden of Earth. Animals, insects, poisons, tools, and people that may hinder the spread of your plants, or unwittingly help.

The scientist with the most points and the end is the winner and shall be proclaimed Overseer of the new Earth.

Set number one will be "American Wildflowers". Later expansions will cover Mold, Fungus, Diatoms, Roses, Trees, etc.

125825.name: Toy Soldiers: Cold War

videogamehonor.29996: 2012 D.I.C.E. Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee

125825.description:
The Cold War ignites when '80s era action toys come alive and wage war. Toy Soldiers: Cold War delivers hours of intense combat combined with addictive action strategy gameplay!

Superpowers collide in this playful homage to '80s action toys and films! Command the powerful Cold War arsenals of the USA or USSR armies. Control base turrets, modern combat vehicles, fighter jets, attack helicopters, and commando action figures! Whether lighting up the Toy Box alone or jumping into the fray with your friends, battle in campaign, co-op, or competitive modes%2E Fight for the high score in the addictive mini-games, and while you're at it, don't forget to BLOW EVERYTHING UP!

Source: The Developer Website.

125826.name: Genius Triangle
125826.description:
Like Score Four bit the base is triangle instead of square.

In his turn player places marble on one of the pins.
The winner is the player who first places four marbles in a row on the pins, vertically, horizontally or diagonally.

125827.name: Hütchen-Roulette
125827.description: On a game gimmick with home bases for each player and flipper arms each player tries to be the first to get one one’s cones back into the home base. One player lets the ball rolling along the outer rim and thus moves the flipper arm. This arm shows how many spaces the player must pass with one of his cones. If the move ends on a flipper space the cone may end in the well at the next move of the flipper arm. If one ends on another cone, this is sent back to the home base.

125829.name: Multimatch II
125829.description:
The divisions on the Multimatch I tiles are turned from diagonal to vertical/horizontal to get this other set of 24 unique 3-color squares. Here the color-matching gets trickier because each edge has two segments to be matched up.

Players take turns placing tiles on the 5x5 gameboard. Edges must match and the first piece placed on a border of the board determines the color of that border. Last player wins.

125830.name: Papillon
125830.description:
Papillon tries to flee the Devil’s Island, to do that the piece must be moved off board. The other player tries to catch Papillon. Each piece can move one step per turn. If a piece is enclosed by two opposing pieces, it is taken off the board, but not if a piece actively moves between two pieces. If Papillon is taken off, the game ends.
In a variant the pieces can move any distance and Papillon must be enclosed on four sides.

Similar to Ard Ri, except on a 9x9 board.

125832.name: Pittsburgh 68
125832.description:
Thrills and and chills await in Pittsburgh 68, a frenzied game of zombie horror! One player starts as a zombie and the rest as survivors on the run. As survivors are eliminated, they become part of the growing zombie problem. Those who avoid becoming zombified are the "winners", but only if they survive the final draw!

The game is played in four segments called "reels". Each reel has a designated number of cards to be played through. As these are revealed in a central three-card hand, players have the option to take them on their turn to build their survivor or zombie hands. In addition to cards, the Shuffling Horror system uses two six-sided dice (2d6) to resolve conflict actions, such as when a zombie attacks a survivor. The game includes two sets of dice. The Zombie Master makes many dice rolls and reserves one set as his own, while the players should pass their set as each player completes her turn.

Spoints – short for survivor points – are the final component of the Shuffling Horror system. These counters track the survivors' vitality and luck, and survivors use spoints to cheat the system.

Pittsburgh 68 is a game that revels in zombie mayhem. As such, its outcome varies greatly. Our advice is to just let the zombies run amuck.

Well...not quite run...

Shuffle.

125833.description:
Carousel is the overarching name for a series of prototypes that played around with the same core mechanic. The concept is simple: There is no good or bad card in the game.

Every card has every action on it, shuffled around a series of slots. On the center of the table there are several places, each with a number which matches one of the slots. The place in which your characters is defines the slot you can use on all your cards. You'll want to control that character to use your cards as best you can.

Once the base mechanics were set, the game went through several themes: Time travel, gangsters robbing a bank, delivering mail, delivering pizzas. It immediately made the game easier to learn since the players had a train of thought they could follow. The game adapted to each of the themes, and grew with it.

Its latest iteration is called Multiuniversum and is going to be published by Board & Dice later this year!
125833.name: Carousel

125834.name: Sci-Fi Beta Kappa (1KM1KT)
125834.description:
From: Publishers website

Get into a spot of bother on your homeworld? Don’t fancy a spell on the prison planet? No problem, go and do a degree at Weber College, the fustiest, dustiest learning establishment on the East Coast. Eh? Don’t like the sound of that? Prison planet it is then. Yeah, thought that’d make you change your mind. Next shuttle leaves in ten hours. You’d better be on it.
Don’t know much about History? Biology? A science book? Then you’ll fit right in to Alien House. It’s the coolest, hippest, happening-est frat house on campus, but watch out! Dean ‘Wormhole’ is on the warpath. He’s been trying to have Alien House closed down for years, and now he thinks he’s got them just where he wants them. Complete your studies, have a cracking time and save Alien House from closure. Do you think you can manage that?
Sci-Fi Beta Kappa is a game where players take on the role of slacker aliens with a bunch of abilities such as power manipulation, enhanced senses, larceny, super strength etc., who, having been kicked off their homeworlds for various misdemeanours, have been exiled to Terra. There, they get into all sorts of scrapes and are under constant surveillance by Dean ‘Wormhole’, who hates aliens and is always looking for an excuse to close down Alien House.

125835.name: Brent Crude
125835.description:
‘Brent Crude’ is a two-to-five player game about the oil industry.

Players grow their businesses by purchasing oil fields, pipelines, storage tanks, refineries, and retail outlets. They produce crude oil at offshore platforms and pipe it onshore to sell or store. They ship stored oil to refineries, where it is converted into diesel, petrol, and liquid petroleum gas. Finally, they deliver those refined products by lorry to retail outlets, where they score victory points (with bonus points for previsously-established outlets of their own). Or they ship the refined products to Rotterdam to sell for money.

The value of each good varies according to the rules of supply and demand.

125836.name: A Thousand Years of Blood
125836.description:
This game was designed for the 24-Hour Game Design Contest - June 2012.

A Thousand Years of Blood is a solitaire game where the player takes on the role of a superhuman in an alternate-universe future. After Hitler's assassination in 1944, a superhuman named Heinrich Kirchner took power over Nazi Germany. Under his reign, the Nazis took over the world. As a virtual immortal, Heinrich began a thousand-year Reich.

You are a Nazi experiment with superhuman abilities of your own. And you plan to end Heinrich's rule and put a stop to his thousand-year plans.

The game requires a simple PocketMod, a pencil, a d6, and a d8. The player selects two of seven unique abilities, then uses the dice to randomly generate the maps of the three levels. Actual gameplay in the first two levels in completely non-random, as the player seeks to move from the Start point of the map to the End point while taking as little damage as possible from the various enemies. If you end your turn in an enemy's line of sight, you take damage, so watch out! The third level is less about sneaking and more about combat, so there is more randomization--Heinrich teleports to different points on the map while activating Laser Turrets and blasting you with lightning.

125837.name: Details of the Future
125837.description:
From publisher blurb:

The future is a foreign country, impossibly complex and fast moving. Everything is different in 2107, beyond just the obvious fact that an well armed pagan techno-utopia wages war against a Christian theocracy using posthuman supersoldiers as its primary weapon. The details matter more.

Details of the Future is a FREE minisourcebook collecting these details. A collection of system-free random creation charts that let you randomly build minor NPCs, back ground events and set dressing. Since these details are system free they are equally useful in a D20 Modern based Otherverse America campaign, clinic management sims run using the upcoming Frontlines of Choice system, or any other modern or near-future cyberpunk, espionage or sci-fi game you play in.

125838.name: Fundamentals of Tabletop Roleplaying, Second Iteration
125838.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fundamentals of Tabletop Roleplaying is just what it says on the tin - a run-through of what happens in a tabletop roleplaying game, including basic information on running games and simple advice for everyone involved.

In addition to being a general guide to these basics, Fundamentals is part of a complete gaming platform. The other components are:
1. Ouroboros Tabletop Roleplaying Engine, Third Iteration, a general engine for fantasy gaming.

2. Tenocha: The Old Empire, Second Iteration, a fantastic setting for roleplay.

3. Situations For Tabletop Roleplaying, Second Iteration, a collection of methods for building good situations for tabletop gaming.

125839.name: Ouroboros Tabletop Roleplaying Engine, Third Iteration
125839.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a rules engine designed for use in fantasy roleplaying. Features of the core mechanism:

Resolution uses a small pool of d20s, attempting to score equal or under an attribute.
It's very easy for the Guide to present interesting choices and complex situations as single rolls, by setting up the dangers and opportnities each roll provides - and for players to decide not just "IF they do well" but "HOW they do well" when stakes like that are played out.
"Breath" is used as a means of tracking encumbrance and weariness, as stunt points, and for use in social action.




This engine doesn't include a setting, introduction to roleplaying, or precdure for building gaming situations. These are available for download, however:
1. Fundamentals of Tabletop Roleplaying, Second Iteration, a guide to the very basics of playing tabletop RPGs.

2. Tenocha: The Old Empire, Second Iteration, a fantastic setting for roleplay.

3. Situations For Tabletop Roleplaying, Second Iteration, a collection of methods for building good situations for tabletop gaming.

boardgamecompilation.153137: Among the Stars: Expanding the Alliance

125841.description:
These are exclusive promos offered as rewards to contributors of the game's crowd-funding campaign.

The promos are:
- 10 Dual Location card (5 different).
- 2 New alien races (Debos, Nyxtos) + 3 Nyxtos tokens
- 4 New objective cards
- 2 Sleeve packs (100 each)
- 4 Limited resin starship miniatures
- 2 Casino location cards + 1 small six sided die
- 12 Infestation conflict cards + 4 infestation markers + 1 Infestation conflict rules card
- 10 Special location card (5 different)
125841.name: Among the Stars: Indiegogo Promos

125842.name: Situations For Tabletop Roleplaying, Second Iteration
125842.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a compilation of the six situation-building tools presently available from Levi Kornelsen, reformatted into a single book-style PDF. Those situation-builders are:

Long Knives is used to create situations for intrigue that the characters are tied to.
Broken Places builds situations where a villain of some sort has taken over an organization.
The Quest is used to generate adventures that will take the characters out on significant journeys
Transgression is a generator for social movements and the resistance to those movements.
Predator Souls is a means for making monster-hunting scenarios for your games.
Nine Rooms is a method for setting up dungeons, the classical limited-space perilous situations.




The record sheets are also available full-page sized, in a second file that is part of this product.

This engine doesn't include a setting, introduction to roleplaying, or precdure for building gaming situations. These are available for download, however:
1. Fundamentals of Tabletop Roleplaying, Second Iteration, a guide to the very basics of playing tabletop RPGs.

2. Ouroboros Tabletop Roleplaying Engine, Third Iteration, a general engine for fantasy gaming.

3. Tenocha: The Old Empire, Second Iteration, a fantastic setting for play.

125843.name: Tenocha: The Old Empire, Second Iteration
125843.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tenocha: The Old Empire is a setting for tabletop roleplaying; it is one part of a complete game. The other components are:
1. Fundamentals of Tabletop Roleplaying, Second Iteration, a guide to the very basics of playing tabletop RPGs.

2. Ouroboros Tabletop Roleplaying Engine, Third Iteration, a fairly light set of rules that this setting was designed to work with.

3. Situations For Tabletop Roleplaying, Second Iteration, a set of situation generators for creating setups for gaming.

125844.name: Burning Bridges
125844.description:
From Introduction:

Burning Bridges is a Game-in-a-Can scenario presented by StoryWeaver Productions, and is an excellent way to start gaming in the world of Hael. The characters and events that unfold here and centered around the efforts of a Daeorc noble attempting to prevent a major war, and the attacks of an assassin who is trying to start it. This module also details the central section of the 'High Bridge' that links northern and southern halves of the Imperial city of Crossplains, and in fact the northern and southern continents of Hael.

125845.name: Hallo Paket!
125845.description:
How many presents will Steffi and Max get? It is the birthday of the twins Steffi and Max, and we're all invited. Naurally we want to wish them the best and bring lots of presents. The first packet is on the truck, and another ... and it's going! Now we have to run after the truck and load more packages on it; the more, the better! Can we get them all on the truck?

Hallo Paket! is a cooperation game. The goal is to load 12 gift packages on a truck, before it arrives at the birthday party. All children win if they can do it, otherwise all lose.

---

Wieviele Geschenke bekommen Steffi und Max? Die Zwillinge Steffi und Max haben Geburtstag. Und wir sind alle eingeladen! Natürlich wollen wir den beiden eine große Freude machen und so viele Pakete mitbringen, wie wir nur können. Geschafft! Das erste Paket liegt auf dem Lastwagen und noch eines und ... Da fährt er auch schon weiter. Jetzt aber schnell hinterher und weitere Pakete aufladen; je mehr, desto besser! Ob es gelingt, alle Pakete aufzuladen?

Aufmachung: Der Kurs besteht aus 20 Feldern und führt zu einem Haus. Der Lastwagen ist recht gut gelungen und wurde aus Holz gefertigt. Auf seiner Ladefläche können die Pakete gut untergebracht werden. Die Pakete sind kleine Holzquader in verschiedenen Farben, die auf einer Seite mit einer Schleife bedruckt sind. Sie werden im mitgelieferten Stoffsack aufbewahrt. Der Spezialwürfel hat Werte zwischen 1 und 5, sowie ein LKW-Symbol. Das gesamte Spiel ist in einer ittelgroßen Verpackung produziert worden.
Ziel: Bei diesem Kooperationsspiel müssen alle Pakete auf den Wagen aufgeladen werden, bevor dieser schließlich das Haus erreicht.
Am Anfang werden die Pakete auf das Startfeld gestellt. Der Lastwagen startet von einem etwas entfernten Straßenfeld. Jeder Spieler hat eine oder zwei eigene Paketfarben (je nach Anzahl der Spieler).
Der Startspieler beginnt und würfelt. Entsprechend der Augenzahl darf er ein Paket voranbewegen. Auf einem Feld dürfen beliebig viele Pakete stehen, man darf jedoch nicht über den Lastwagen hinaus ziehen. Kann man kein eigenes Paket bewegen, muß man das eines Mitspielers nehmen.
Landet das Paket genau auf dem Feld des Lastwagens, wird es aufgeladen.
Würfelt man ein Lastwagen-Symbol, wird das Fahrzeug um ein Feld in Richtung Haus bewegt.
Wenn bereits zwei eigene Pakete auf dem LKW sind, darf man in seinem Zug auch Mitspielern helfen und deren Pakete ziehen, wenn dies vorteilhafter ist. Auch wenn der Spieler alle eigenen Pakete im LKW hat, spielt er weiterhin mit und hilft den Mitspielern.
Spielende: Die Partie ist vorbei, wenn der LKW das Zielfeld erreicht. Hat er nun mindestens acht Pakete geladen, gewinnen die Spieler gemeinsam.

125846.name: Treasure Book on Demand
125846.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Treasure Book on Demand is a supplement of generated treasure covering every Hoard Class in the Labyrinth Lord System. Additionally, it contains unprotected treasure spanning all five classes defined in the rule system. One hundred results are given for each treasure type.

The treasure results are divided by section and enumerated providing quick treasure data for ad-hoc encounters or dungeon stocking. The results are based purely on the random tables. TBoD is based on the free product of the same name but includes additional editing and formatting.

125847.name: June 2012: Starting Locations
125847.description:
From Introduction:

Sometimes a GM needs a little help coming up with good starting locations for multiple players, and/or justifying a reason for the players being congregated together as they are. Sometimes players will want to start in locations that are either less than ideal, or alternatively, too strong for a GM’s chosen ‘standard’ zombie type. Sometimes a GM purposely wants to place players in a less than ideal starting location to jump right into the horror element. The following are examples of sample starting locations for players, with a Scenario Point or Risk modifi er based on how useful the location (or potential Stronghold) is to the characters. GM’s are encouraged to use the examples below as a baseline to award Scenario Points (or add additional Risk) for their own unique starting locations as they see fit.

125848.name: NBA All-Star Challenge 2
125848.description:
From the back of the US Game Boy Box

"Jam it home" as one of 27 NBA All-Stars in the backboard shattering sequel to the best in NBA Game Boy hoops. It's a whole new ball game with the likes of Clyde Drexler, Dominique Wilkins, Chris Mullin, Hakeem Olajuwon, Dikembe Mutombo and more!

Six Exciting Half Court Games:
-Slam Dunk Competition
-3 Point Shootout
-One-On-One
-Free Throw Contest
-Accuracy Showdown
-NBA All-Star Tournament

Challenge your friends to head to head action with Game Boy Link!

125849.name: Hillbilly Hell
125849.description:
You and your friends thought it would be fun to go on a little backwoods camping trip. You’d heard the rumors about missing campers, but thought it was just stories to frighten tourists. Then, when you found the hidden side trail, you just couldn’t resist a good hike. Now, you’re running for your lives and you know the stories are true.
You can hear some of your friends screaming in the distance, but you have no idea where you are. You just want to find your way out, to escape this place. But those screams, how can you leave your friends behind? Suddenly, you notice the woods around you have gone quiet. Something’s not right.
As you realize you’re not alone, you also remember something one of your friends said- “There’s a reason it’s the road less traveled!”.

Hillbilly Hell is a semi-cooperative game of Horror, Survival, Rescue, and Escape for 1-3 Players. In Hillbilly Hell, you play as a group of lost Hikers that have stumbled into the path of a family of inbred cannibal rednecks. Players must look for a way out while helping one another (if they choose to) survive being hunted for sport, food, or worse. The player whose Hikers can survive or escape, and gain the most Survival Points along the way, wins.

125851.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 29/30 - May/Jun 2012)
125851.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #029/030: May/June 2012

Cover: Ian Stead

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from the Freelance Traveller web site.

125852.name: From Start to Finish
125852.description:
This 2 player children's game consists of a board, a rabbit and a die. Both players use the rabbit, which starts the game in a field in the middle of the board. One player's goal is to move the rabbit to a carrot patch, the other's goal is to move the rabbit to a lettuce patch.

Each player moves the rabbit toward their goal in turn using the number rolled on the die. There are two types of special squares. Landing on a plank gives that player an extra turn. Landing on a fence causes that player to lose a turn.

First player to reach their goal wins.

125853.description:
The Moloch attack on Omega had unforeseen consequences: Damage to the facility set three strange creatures free. They are the product of a secret genetic research project, code named "Dancer". Now, half-mad and with no control over their instincts, creatures begin fighting for survival in the post-apocaliptic wasteland. The Dancer is a completely new challenge for Neuroshima Hex players.

Neuroshima Hex! The Dancer is the second army pack, part of a series of mini game expansions containing one Neuroshima Hex army. The army’s author is one of the game's most hardcore fans, known worlwide for his great fan armies published on BoardGameGeek.com – Rustan Håkansson from Sweden.

Dancer was first published as a PDF file on BoardGameGeek and soon became very popular. It is one of the most original and strange designs ever made for Neuroshima Hex. This army has three HQ tiles and no unit tiles at all! All tiles in this army are action tiles (Move, Push back, Battle, etc.).
125853.name: Neuroshima Hex! Dancer

boardgamefamily.7757: From RPG books to board games

125854.description:
Game description from the publisher:

London, 1873 – The Royal Academy of Space Exploration has announced its intention to launch a mission to Mars by year's end. In its quest to claim, fully explore, and map the great red planet, the Academy is holding recruitment competitions for various positions on the crew. A position central to the crew's mission, the Astronautical Engineer must be resourceful and efficient in his construction of various mechanisms and ship maintenance.

In Mars Needs Mechanics, players represent engineers and tinkerers from all over the Empire who have come to compete for this prodigious opportunity. Starting the game with only 30 cogs (currency), players will utilize unique game mechanisms that emphasize timing to collect sets of components and build steampunk mechanisms aimed at earning even more cogs. At the end of the competition, the engineer with the most cogs will earn his place as Astronautical Engineer on the crew of the H.M.S. Victoria VII.
125854.name: Mars Needs Mechanics

125855.name: Trivia Puzzle
125855.description:
Trivia Puzzle is a trivia game in which players select 1 of 6 puzzles of equal size (# pieces per puzzle) and race to be the first to complete their puzzle. Players obtain pieces of their puzzle by correctly answering a question from a trivia card during their turn. During a player's turn, another player pulls a trivia card from the box and reads the category out loud. The active player then decides a factor of difficulty (1,2,3,4 or 5...1 being the easiest and 5 the most difficult) for the question as there are 5 questions per card for the topic. If the player answer the question correctly, they randomly pull that number of puzzle pieces (1-5) from their puzzle box and begin building their puzzle, at which time their turn ends. Turn passes to the next player for incorrect guesses.

Note: there are over 3,000 question and 20 categories to choose from (Science, Math, Sports, Media, Famous People, Firsts & Mosts, Games, Animals, Movies, Places, Literature, World Events, General Trivia).

125856.name: Brain Bender
125856.description:
North American Game Boy Box Text

Test your prowess as a master of mirrors in one of the world's most exciting new puzzle games, Brain Bender! Use mirrors to manipulate your laser beams and destroy gas spheres, shut down Electrobrains, and finally destroy the enemy satellite! There are 120 challenging puzzles in this game - each a new challenge for you to solve. Get your mind in motion over one of the hottest games ever, Brain Bender!

125857.name: Downtown Nekketsu Kōshinkyoku: Dokodemo Daiundōkai
125857.description:
User Summary

Downtown Nekketsu Kōshinkyoku: Dokodemo Daiundōkai or translated as Downtown Nekketsu March: The Great Portable Athletic Meet is game in the Kunio Kun series. This game includes multiple outdoor sports events in the Kunio Kun style.

125858.name: Game of Troublesome Pigs
125858.description: After raiding the garden, those troublesome pigs flee the angry farmer and his trusty dog as the farmer waves his fist and swings his hickory stick. A simple roll and move game over a pretty complex game board. Game is Circa 1900-1910 and features some of Milton Bradley's finest early chromatography/lithography.

125860.name: Call it Qids
125860.description:
Wargame of the Battle of Qadesh fought in 1275 BC between the Egyptian army led by Pharaoh Ramesses II and the Hittites under the Great King Muwatalli II. Qids is an alternative name for Quadesh (modern Tell Nebi Mend in Syria).

The game starts with the Hittite's ambushing the Egyptian Pre division, then attacking Ramesses' camp with the Pharaoh and the Amun division. Egyptian reinforcements (the Nearin) appear once the camp is successfully attacked. The game is eight turns long.

Forces are chariots, infantry, baggage and Ramesses himself. Movement is by rectangular areas, with special rules for the camp. Combat is resolved by dice; The Ramesses unit (following his own account of the battle) can overthrow the enemy easily, but is badly outnumbered. The victory level is decided by how many chariots the Egyptians capture and how much baggage the Hittites take and if they can capture the Pharaoh himself.

This was the 2012 subscription bonus game for members, but will be available from the publishers.

125861.description:
Bear's Claw is two-games-in-one; featuring two separate and standalone, operational-level treatments of the German advance and the Soviet counter attack from July to August 1941 during Operation Barbarossa.

Kiev-Uman covers the action of German Army Group South, from the beginning of Soviet bold counterattack on 26 June led by the Soviet South-Western Front comprising four full mechanized corps (more than 2,000 tanks), to the closing of the Uman Pocket on 6 August.

Smolensk covers the action of German Army Group Center, from the German 2nd Panzergruppe's crossing of the Dnepr on 11 July, followed by numerous Soviet counterattacks of the Soviet Western Front led by Marshal Timoshenko, to the climax of operations at Smolensk on 9 August.

Both games share a common set of rules and deliver a quick, yet intensive gaming experience as BOTH sides will have the opportunity to initiate attacks during play. In essence, these are not one-sided affairs as the pendulum will swing in the Soviet's favor as well as they attempt to mount several counter blows to thwart the German advance.

UPDATE (8 Dec 2013): Consim Press is upgrading the components to the game. The half map sheet will now be a full 22x34" map sheet and the counter size is increasing from 1/2" to 9/16" counters!

UPDATE (26 Feb 2015): Check out both counter sheets in the Images section. These are the new, larger 9/16" counters for the game to complement the larger, full-sized map. Bear's Claw will be released in 2015.

Now available for preorder from Consim Press
125861.name: Bear's Claw: The Battles of Kiev-Uman and Smolensk, 1941

125862.name: In The Soup
125862.description: A Tiddly Winks type game. The game comes with 4 miniature salt cellars, 4 small counters of differing colors and 1 large snapping piece. The object is to try and not knock over any of the Salt Cellar pieces while landing on the same color area as the area that you started in. A counter must be clearly on the same and outside of the soup dish. Any piece resting on the same color scores 15 points and counters resting on a different color scores 5 points. Each salt cellar still standing scores 5 points. Minuses for any counter IN THE SOUP (minus 10 points), every salt cellar down but not in the soup (minus 5 points) and for every salt cellar down resting clearly over the line separating the soup from the edge of the Soup Dish (minus 5 points). Game is played in turns to a score of 100. First to that score wins.

125863.description:
Mice of Valor is a strategy game about clans of mice contending to retrieve the most cheese. Players take turns moving their mice around the board to uncover tokens. This can be done by moving onto one, or by sniffing out the area before moving ahead. However...

It's not so easy as it sounds! The humans have placed deadly traps and poison everywhere, and two hungry cats prowl the area. While poison can simply be avoided, to score cheese from traps and escape the cats' clutches will require skillful use of slide cards. Don't forget about rival clans either - they'll resort to thievery if they have to!
125863.name: Mice of Valor

125864.description:
Mamma Mia: Double Ingredients is a promotional expansion for Mamma Mia consisting of 10 double ingredient cards, two in each of the five ingredients.

During game set-up, the double ingredient cards are substituted into the deck in place of two ingredients of each type. For game play, a double ingredient is handled exactly the same as the single ingredients, but of course count as two ingredients of that kind.

If an ingredient is needed to complete an order, double ingredients on display must be used first. If necessary, a player must overpay, which also applies to double ingredients played from the hand to complete an order.

Also included with Spielbox Magazine #2/2015.
125864.name: Mamma Mia: Double Ingredients

125865.name: Horrors of Halloween: Monsters of Myth to Horrify Your Heroes
125865.description:
From publisher blurb:

Six mythic villains from famous tales of tragic terror!

TG Publishing presents: Horrors of Halloween, Monsters of Myth to Horrify Your Heroes, a supplement for the 4th edition of the World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game. This 13 page PDF details six villains that can be used to oppose your party, and since there are 2 villains per tier, the horror can span the entire campaign!

125866.name: Awesome Possum
125866.description: Awesome Possum is a press your luck game where players are possums trying to cross the highway to save their possum babies. Each turn players decide whether to attempt a crossing or go home with the babies they've already rescued. If they decide to cross the road, they choose which section of the road they want to cross. After all players have chosen a section of road, those sections are revealed to see if they were successful. Successful crossings allow them to rescue more possum babies. Unsuccessful crossings send the possum back home until next round. Play continues until all possum babies have been rescued or all possums have gone home. The winner is the possum with the highest score, 2pts for each of their own baby possums and 1pt for each of an opponent's baby possums.

125867.name: Bokor Base Class
125867.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody eats at our table!

Gather 'round the table and eat up! This Goblin Ration's made with some Cajun spices! Line up and get a healthy scoop of Pathfinder goodness with the "Bokor" base class in this Goblin Ration, our free micro PDFs!

125868.name: Knight Alternate Class
125868.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody eats at our table!
Step up and grab a free copy of "Goblin Rations", our free micro PDFs!
Sample a healthy smattering of design goblin goodness.
This week's PDF is the "Knight" alternate class for the Cavalier!
Tired of lugging that big dumb horse around? Want a bit of chivalry in your life? Then the knight's right for you!

125869.name: Lizardfolk Racial Guide
125869.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody eats at our table... though this week the food might bite back!
Step up and grab a free copy of "Goblin Rations", our free micro PDFs!
Sample a healthy smattering of design goblin goodness.
This week's PDF is the Lizardfolk racial guide, coupled with a prestige class just for them!
Dinosaur-wrestling lizards your thing? How about an impressive bite attack! Sound good? Then come and check out this weeks free PDF!

125870.name: The Wolong Prestige Class
125870.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody eats at our table!

Step up and grab a free copy of "Goblin Rations", our free micro PDFs!

Sample a healthy smattering of design goblin goodness.

This week's PDF is the "Wolong" prestige class.

Munch on some yummy action economy altering appetizers, followed by some quotes by some dead guys, and served with a healthy side of strategy! Or are you the kind of goblin who likes to eat dessert first? No worries! With this class you can have your “courses” (aka actions) in any order you want!

125871.name: Little Red Goblin Games Free Sample Pack
125871.description:
From publisher blurb:

A lot of us here at Little Red have been involved with gaming for a while now. It's helped us out when times seamed bad and helped us lift other people us when they needed a hand. So it's with that same spirit of community that we want to give back. Presented here in these pages is a lot of hard work from a lot of talented people. We've spent a great deal of time putting together this little gift to the community we've come to know and love. We hope
you have as much fun playing it as we did making it! In addition to the community, we'd like to thank the people

who've made this community what it is today. People like Dave Arneson, Gary Gygax, Skip Williams, Monte Cook, Jason Bulmahn, Jonathan Tweet, Lisa Stevens, and all the people at both Paizo and Wizards who have put so many hours in making this hobby so much more than "just rolling dice". (Your work really means a lot to us here at Little Red.)

It's loaded with free goodies for you to enjoy! Here are just some of the things included in our gift to you!

Two new modules, including "A Face Only Stolkholm Could Love!" from our public playtests.
New monsters, including The Man Eating Lily and The Lonely People!
The new path for druids: The Bestial Champion!

125872.name: Tome of Manly Things
125872.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a man!
You must be deft as the pledging fratboy
Be a man!
With all the force of a great platoon!
Be a man!
With all the strength of a Dad's raging ire!
Mysterious as that night you blacked out in Cancoon!

User note: This was the 2012 April Fool's product for Little Red Goblin Games.

125873.name: Pożeracze Umysłów
125873.description:
Two player old style game with counters, hex grid board and classic mechanic I-go-you-go.

One side is human colonist, second native aliens.

Aliens have mental powers and try to take control on humans. Humans have weapons and try to destroy hostile aliens.

Player try to move with his characters to outmaneuvre and capture in range enemy units. Then roll for take control or fire at alien.

Goal of the game is simple, to survive and eliminate all enemy units.

125874.name: FUBAR Generic Sci-Fi
125874.description:
From the publisher website:

"These allow you to games across a range of popular SciFi settings and genres from Aliens to Terminator and Predator."

Keeping in line with the one-page philosophy of FUBAR System, this simple expansion permits to players to give a sci-fi flavor to their FUBAR games.

125875.name: Micro FUBAR
125875.description:
From the publisher's website:

"A lot of people started asking if we could produce a version of FUBAR suitable for the increasingly popular 6mm scale. Here is the development draft of what we have done so far."

This can help FUBAR players to tailor their games from the 25/28mm generic base FUBAR to a more wide 6mm battlefield. With the inclusion of some rules for vehicles, this ruleset does not differ a lot from the basic one. It is obviously a one page ruleset in the FUBAR philosophy.

125876.name: Bop It! Smash
125876.description:
Taken from the game's official web page on Hasbro.com:

Bop It! is a brand that has built success on a simple concept: challenging your reaction time. Using a handheld game unit, players follow easy voice commands quickly and precisely, or they lose. It is straightforward and positively addictive! Bop It Smash takes the action one step further with moving lights, playing on an arcade theme that’s impossible to resist.

Time it right and smash the light! With BOP IT SMASH, colored lights in the center of the game unit fly back and forth while you do your best to capture one in the Zone. It’s active and fun – you and your friends will keep playing until you smash those lights every time!

125877.name: Big Happy Vacation
125877.description:
"A Game Of Family Discovery"

This is a board game designed to help family members get to know each other in new and different ways.

Players move around the board and respond to provocative or silly questions depending on the color-coded shape of the space where they land. There are two decks of cards, one for adults and one for children. The questions are structured to provide an open environment for discussion without confrontation. Some cards prompt a player to create a story, which the other contestants judge for creativity and originality.

The first player to reach the end of the vacation pathway with all six "Lucky Symbols" is declared the winner. That family member gets a free wish, like a special dinner of their choice.

Includes a colorful board, six pewter tokens, one die, two decks of cards in a "suitcase" card holder, the rules, and a large cloth carrying bag. There is no outer box.

Designed for kids age 5-12 to play with parents or grandparents.

125878.name: 2192 Invasion: Earth
125878.description:
Strategic level wargame based on Space Battleship Yamato 2199 is Japanese anime series. This game covers the war before main story begins.

This game is like Imperium the classic Science Fiction game, the position of both players is different. Earth(Terran) player control entire Earth star fleet, but Gamilas player control one of a local fleet in the galactic empire of Gamilas.
The game map divided into four planets and one dwarf planet areas, the Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn and Pluto.
Each unit represent one space warship. Earth player manage its operate and shipbuilding, but Gamilas players manage only operate and he will need to request reinforcements to their home star.

Gamilas player win, if annihilate the human race by the radioactive meteorite bombs or build a Gamilas base on the Earth. Earth player win, if completely stopped the radioactive meteorite bombing tactics. If all these conditions are not achieved, victory is determined by control of the areas.

142026.name: Fallen City of Karez: Burned Oak Tavern

125879.description:
The city of Karez was once the crowned jewel in the vast kingdom of King Tyrial, but as he lost grasp on his kingdom, the city fell to ruins at the hands of the dark forces surrounding it. Now the king has died, and his heir, King Tyrial II, has decided to dispatch his finest lords to raise the fallen city and stand ground against all its enemies, within and outside the city walls.

In Fallen City of Karez, each player will take the role of a lord of one of the guilds who seek to tighten their grasp on the rising city. The players will strive to maintain a balance between keeping the city safe for its citizens by sending exploration parties to defeat any threats, and at the same time attracting to the emerging city new adventurers wishing to fill their pockets with fortunes and their names with glory.

In the action phase at the start of each of the eight turns, players can assign two citizens or one adventurer to act on their behalf in the various buildings of Karez, send an exploration party to remove any threats that lurk near Karez, or buy new equipment to reinforce their parties of heroes. Some guild houses may choose to erect their own private Dungeons (!) in an attempt to inflict havoc and dismay on the other houses. After everyone performs their actions, the players must check how these actions affected migration to Karez; the results of this phase will reflect on the growth of Karez towards a city state, which is the common aspiration of all players.

Players start with different initial possessions and owned buildings. In addition to the common goal of raising the city, each house also has some unique goals (ambitions), which will eventually determine the sole winner. That said, the game is semi-cooperative in that while each guild has its own ambitions, all players must succeed in raising the city by the end of the game or else everyone loses.
125879.name: Fallen City of Karez

125880.name: Temple Pyramid
125880.description:
From the Introduction:

This massive, approximately 80 feet tall, square step pyramid, measuring no less than 130 feet at its base, and others like it dominate the centres of ancient cities, wrought from the surrounding forest, or at the very least their ruins. Countless tons of stone have been moved to erect this intimidating structure. It consists of no less than five steps, narrowing towards the top with a temple built on top of the smallest topmost step. On all four sides the steps of steep staircases ascend towards this temple, ever burning fires blazing in braziers at their bottom. The dark interior of the temple is dominated by a simple but large stone block which serves as an altar.

125881.name: Armed Forces Corp
125881.description:
Box Description:

As a member of a highly trained and heavily armed mercenary group called The Armed Forces Corp, you are to recover precious information located in a skyscraper overrun by well organized terrorists. Just remember, when money is involved... no one can be trusted.

-Use advanced warfare equipment, including night vision goggles, M84 flash bangs or S10 gas mask.

-Experience astonishing graphics, dynamic lighting, breathtaking effects and outstanding AI.

-Use modern firearms and special Ops techniques to quickly and efficiently locate and eliminate the enemy.

125882.name: Code Of Honor 3: Desperate Measures
125882.description:
Box Description:

Join an elite squad of the French Foreign Legion on their first mission in the country of their origin. On emergency orders from the president and with a nation-wide social crisis in the background, fight a malevolent crime organization that plans to take advantage of the situation and mount a large scale weapons theft that could destabilize the world.

-Immerse in a realistic world of stunning detail, dynamic lighting and breathtaking effects

-Use modern fire arms and unique tactics to quickly locate and eliminate the enemy.

-Hone your skills in an elite squad of the French Foreign Legion during a mission of unparallel importance

125883.name: Terrorist Takedown 2: US Navy Seals
125883.description:
User Summary

Terrorist Takedown 2: US Navy Seals is a modern war game that takes the player into the "War on Terror". The single player mode requires the playre to resolve a hostage situation in the Middle East. Health can be recovered through medipacks or by avoiding combat for a period of time.

125884.name: Apprentices
125884.description:
From the publisher:

"Even the mightiest wizard of the Order of Hermes once cast his very first spell.

"The greatest Bonisagus magus of the age was once taught the rudiments of Magic Theory. There was a time when even the dragon-slaying Flambeau faced his fear of the cook to pilfer cakes from the kitchen. And the powerful Mentem maga who now pulls the strings of kings and bishops once pined for a glance from a handsome stableboy.

"They were all apprentices once.

"This book contains advice and rules for playing apprentices and other children in Ars Magica. It covers changes to character generation and guidelines for development as a child grows up. Rules for teaching Hermetic Virtues are also included, as well as a broad range of spells suited to an apprentice's abilities. See Mythic Europe anew through the eyes of Apprentices! "

125886.name: Hatchi
125886.description:
Hatchi is a retro-looking iPhone app sure to get the nostalgia burning for all those who cared for a virtual pet back in the 1990s when they were at the height of their popularity. Just as with the keychain-sized pets of the 90s, iPhone users now will feed, clean, play with and generally look after their pets to ensure they grow up to be healthy, happy little Hatchis.

The Hatchi monster will go through several stages of growth, and will develop differently depending on the quality of care the player provides. Successfully raised Hatchi monster will be smarter, happier, and require less attention.

Source: The Game Website.

125888.name: Never Unprepared: The Complete Game Master's Guide to Session Prep

rpghonor.20105: 2012 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee

125888.description:
From the publisher's website:

Whether you’re new to game mastering or have been running the same campaign since 1974, Never Unprepared: The Complete Game Master’s Guide to Session Prep will help you prepare for games faster, avoid common pitfalls, and have more fun in the process. To our knowledge, this is the first book entirely devoted to the process of prepping for tabletop RPGs.

Never Unprepared breaks game prep down into its component phases—Brainstorming, Selection, Conceptualization, Documentation, and Review—and provides the tools you need to make the most of each phase. If you hate prep, you’ll find ways to make it more enjoyable. If you already have a great system for doing your prep, you’ll learn how to make it even better.

Ten years in the making, Never Unprepared is award-winning author Phil Vecchione’s epic rock ballad to game prep. A project manager and veteran game master, he draws on extensive experience to present flexible systems for developing or optimizing your own unique approach to game prep. Phil’s work has previously appeared on GnomeStew.com (silver ENnie Award winner for Best Blog, 2010 and 2011) and in Eureka: 501 Adventure Plots to Inspire Game Masters and Masks: 1,000 Memorable NPCs for Any Roleplaying Game.

Within Never Unprepared you’ll find prep techniques, utilities, and tips that are applicable to any RPG:

- An in-depth look at each phase of session prep, from brainstorming to review
- Templates for sessions, scenes, NPCs, and combats that you can modify to fit your gaming style
- Practical advice on selecting prep tools, putting them to good use, and scheduling enough time to prepare for every session
- How to identify your strengths and weaknesses, as well as tips for preparing when you’re short on time—and what to do if everything goes horribly wrong
- A comprehensive index to make it easy to find what you need

125889.description:
Pollen8 is a simple abstract strategy game in which two players try to capture the opponent's piece. Both players have 19 pieces, divided into two types: the pollen (4 pieces) and pollinators ( 2 ants, 3 lady bugs, and 10 bees). All pieces are red on one side and black on the other. The players start by placing first the pollen pieces on the center of the board with their own color face up. After which, the players can choose to place two bees with piece from previous turn in between them or place a lady bug to flip a row or play the ant to push a row. Each piece must link to another piece at all time. At least 4 pieces are needed to capture an opponent's piece. Each captured piece is removed from the board and has a point. A pollen, a bee, a lady and an ant has 1, 2, 3 and 4 points respectively. The game ends with the first player to get 8 points.

The lady bug and ant are useful for capturing pieces. When played at early stage of the game may result into earning points but at the same time presents difficultly to get additional points at the end part of the game. This also draws your opponent to try to capture your high scoring piece to score big against you. When they are played near the end of the game, it may be also too late to catch up and score ahead. Think ahead and plan you moves, knowing when to use the lady bug and the ant is the key for winning this game.
125889.name: Pollen8

125890.name: Yars' Revenge (2011)
125890.description:
Many eons ago, the evil Qotile enslaved and brainwashed the Yar.

To serve their evil wishes, the Qotile use the Yar as an attack team to expand their control of the galaxy. During one of these attacks, a lone Yar is injured and left for dead. An ancient, wise Yar, Bar Yargler, rescues the Yar soldier. Bar Yargler explains to her the history of the Yar race and why revenge must be taken against the Qotile in order to liberate the Yar and bring peace to the galaxy. He promises to guide her throughout her fight with the Qotile. Armed with explosive Qotile technology, Yar brings the fight to the Qotile.

Will she bring freedom to the Yar or perish in her fight?

Source: The Publisher Website.

125891.name: All About Greeley
125891.description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a "Residence Square" to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

The game board is map of Greeley, Colorado depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. The locations are real businesses in Greeley, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area. The game also came with coupons for businesses advertised.

125892.name: Minute's the Limit
125892.description:
"The educational word game. Fun for everyone from eight to eighty. As seen on T.V."

Minute's the Limit is a word game played over several rounds. In this game, players must write down, under each of five "subject titles", either a place, name, subject or thing that commences with a particular letter of the alphabet. Both subject titles and letters are selected by chance, thus allowing many possible answers. However, each round is timed -- adding further tension and competition to the game.

Each word written down that is deemed acceptable scores points for the player. Each unacceptable word causes the player to lose points. The player with the greatest number of points at the end of the game is the winner.

125894.name: Bad Moon
125894.description:
The year: 1815 AD; the location: Maine, New England.

The village of Cape Grimson has turned into a battleground for ancient vampire houses and savage clans of werewolves. The stench of blood fills the night when the children of the darkness prepare their teeth for the taste of the enemy. Now, it's your time to become the lord of the damned and conquer the night once and for all.

Bad Moon is a fast-paced card-drafting strategy game about the war between vampires, werewolves and other sinister creatures of the night. Players collect victory points by guiding the factions in the war and balancing the battles by secretly playing different factions during the game. The strong factions don't always prevail, mind you; it's all about intrigue and planning the future of the war.

Each round represents one month consisting of four moon phases. Moon phases determine possible movements in the map for different locations. Players play one of their hand cards in order to conduct actions on the map. At the start of each new month new cards are drafted giving the players a chance to change the way of the war.

boardgamehonor.21799: 2012 UK Games Expo Best Abstract Game Winner

125895.name: Foundation

boardgameversion.168097: English first edition (30 handmade numbered copies)

125895.description:
Foundation is an abstract two-player game in which players place their pieces onto a grid board. Points are scored according to the number of existing pieces in contact with the piece already played, irrespective of color. Additionally, the four corner spaces and the central square are marked with a dot; pieces played over these dots score one extra point.

Each player has 14 pieces: straights, zig zags, "U" shapes, and corners of varying sizes. The pieces must be placed right side up, which is indicated by a groove carved into the top of the pieces. This often leads to difficult decisions needing to be made as to how to get the majority of your pieces onto the board while maximizing the points scored for each piece and also preventing your opponent from getting his pieces onto the board.

Scoring is recorded using wooden pegs and one track for each player with 0-9 & 0-50 holes in the border of the board. For each piece left at the end of the game, two points are deducted from a player's score.

125896.name: Líder (Número 23 – Mayo 1991)
125896.description:
Spanish Líder Magazine Issue #23
Book Summary:

SUMARIO:

El Estado de la Afición
Clubes, Novedades, Ranking, Communikado, Actividades, Desafíos y Mercadillo, Errata Índice Temático y Cómic.
